title: Closures of different types that do not capture the environment are automatically coerced to function pointers

labels.name: T-lang
labels.description: Relevant to the language team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
I tried this code:

```rust
fn returns_closure(maybe: bool) -> impl Fn(i32) -> i32 {
    if maybe {
        |x| x + 1
    } else {
        |y| y + 2
    }
}
```

I expected that the compilation would fail because the closures have different types:

```
error[E0308]: `if` and `else` have incompatible types
 --> src/main.rs:5:9
  |
2 | /     if maybe {
3 | |         |x| x + 1
  | |         --------- expected because of this
4 | |     } else {
5 | |         |y| y + 2
  | |         ^^^^^^^^^ expected closure, found a different closure
6 | |     }
  | |_____- `if` and `else` have incompatible types
  |
  = note: expected type `[closure@src/main.rs:3:9: 3:18]`
          found closure `[closure@src/main.rs:5:9: 5:18]`
```

Instead, the code compiles.
